name: crookneck
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of yellow squash (= a large vegetable with a hard skin and a lot of seeds at its centre) with a thin, curved neck: Crooknecks have a structure similar to yellow squash but with an orange-yellow tint. Crookneck squash are summer squash with smooth, yellow skin. Yellow crookneck squashes were an important source of food for the American settlers.
More examplesFewer examplesFor a vegetarian option, toss grilled vegetables such as crookneck squash, onions, and carrots with some pesto.The bright orange crookneck squash is a good bush variety for outdoor growing.You'll know the crookneck squash by the way its neck curves over, like a crook.This soup can be made with any kind of crookneck.
